title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 April 2014 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
00:50 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
00:59 <OSIMasson> has quit  
01:08 <sbaloul> has quit  
01:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
01:47 <Denis1> has quit  
02:09 <Slashman> has quit  
02:57 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
03:10 <Slashman> has quit  
03:28 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
03:34 <Slashman> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:58 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
07:29 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:31 <evalica> has quit  
07:31 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <mflorea> has quit  
08:15 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <Emenems> has quit  
10:04 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, what could cause wysiwyg editor to not load? (cache files cannot be loaded -> for example /xwiki/resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/5325D2FACA7E85486F7CD221A0800472.cache.html is missing)  
10:23 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
10:24 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <vmassol> guys, when can we plan the 5.4.4 release?  
10:44 <vmassol> I see there's one issue open: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10225  
10:44 <vmassol> would be nice to plan the 5.4.4 sometime this week  
10:45 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: would be avail to release it?  
10:45 <vmassol> s/would/would you/  
10:45 <vmassol> maybe we could do the release tomorrow?  
10:47 <gdelhumeau> as soon as there is no issues  
10:57 <vmassol> ok cool  
11:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems that http://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Bug+Fixing+Day+58 is not published yet  
11:06 <tmortagne> indeed, I wrote it and wanted to wait until noon and forgot about it  
11:07 <tmortagne> done thanks  
11:07 <vmassol> np  
11:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: when you closed all the lucene-related issues, did you make sure that they were not valid for SOLR too? Becuase if they are we should move them to the SOLR search instead of closing them IMO  
11:12 <tmortagne> they were not valid for SOLR  
11:12 <vmassol> ok  
11:12 <tmortagne> anyway I need to open then back since we can't get rid of Lucence plugin right now  
11:12 <vmassol> I don't think you need to reopen them, we can still mark the lucene plugin as deprecated/retired  
11:13 <vmassol> (even if it's not moved yet)  
11:13 <tmortagne> yea  
11:13 <vmassol> have you checked how complex it is to rewrite the rest part that uses lucene?  
11:13 <vmassol> the problem is that we don't have any search api  
11:13 <vmassol> so I guess we need to tie it to an impl ...  
11:14 <tmortagne> it's not just that, we don't have any way to access the SOLR search through REST right now so we need that also before getting rid of Lucene one  
11:15 <vmassol> there's no internal API?  
11:15 <vmassol> (for searching)  
11:15 <vmassol> java calls  
11:15 <vmassol> (instead of REST)  
11:16 <tmortagne> we are talking about a REST API here  
11:16 <tmortagne> the issue is that nobody can do a SOLR search through REST API in XWiki  
11:16 <vmassol> yes ok but that's something else  
11:16 <tmortagne> the fact that ther is a java API does not change much  
11:16 <vmassol> it's different from the Server REST API I guess  
11:16 <vmassol> since that one is implemented  
11:17 <vmassol> and it proxies to the underlying search  
11:17 <vmassol> no?  
11:17 <tmortagne> I'm talking about default SOLR module which is using embedded SOLR  
11:17 <tmortagne> we can't just answer "no REST unless you use separated SOLR server"  
11:17 <vmassol> I don't understand  
11:17 <vmassol> I thought the search REST API was in the rest-server module  
11:18 <vmassol> checking  
11:19 <tmortagne> rest-server does not depend on SOLR so I doubt that and that would be very bad anyway, rest-server should not depend on the whole word. We need a separated module which come with the REST API for SOLR  
11:19 <tmortagne> the mistake has been done for Lucene and now it's a pain to get rid of it...  
11:19 <vmassol> ok it's in WikiSearchQueryResourceImpl  
11:19 <vmassol> which calls searchQuery  
11:20 <vmassol> which verifies which impl is in use  
11:20 <vmassol> DB, LUCENE, etc  
11:20 <vmassol> lucene, xwql, hql actually  
11:20 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:21 <vmassol> I don't see it that hard to add an swtich for the SOLR query manager dialect  
11:21 <vmassol> s/dialect/query language  
11:21 <vmassol> ofc this means creating some aspect to "unplug" the lucene support  
11:21 <tmortagne> because we have to stop doing this crap... also SOLR already define a REsT API and we should expose that instead  
11:22 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <vmassol> so your idea is to remove the Search feature from the rest-server module  
11:22 <vmassol> and intsead have each search module (solr, etc) offer its Search REST API  
11:22 <vmassol> right?  
11:23 <vmassol> (which seems logical)  
11:23 <tmortagne> yes, you have to know already what module you are using anyway because you indicate it as parameter...  
11:24 <vmassol> yes I agree  
11:24 <vmassol> now changing this is not a small feat if we don't want to break backward compat  
11:24 <vmassol> is there a default if not parameter is passed?  
11:24 <vmassol> I guess it's lucene  
11:24 <tmortagne> we can deprecated it, it's not that hard but what is important is to not continue that for SOLR  
11:24 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <tmortagne> there is no default  
11:25 <tmortagne> if you don't pass a parameter you don't get anything  
11:26 <tmortagne> you get empty result and not an error which is probably pretty wrong too since you have the feeling the search worked  
11:26 <vmassol> actually seems there's no default  
11:26 <vmassol> and no search is done is no param is passed  
11:26 <tmortagne> that's what I said yes :)  
11:29 <vmassol> oops gtg, fridge being delivered… bb in 1 hour…  
11:29 <tmortagne> :)  
11:37 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
19:19 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
19:30 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
20:24 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
20:44 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
22:25 <Denis> has quit  
23:48 <abusenius> has quit
